text: Tap, which means I assume this is a 4% version. Pours hazy chestnut, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, hint of root beer, Pepsi, burned malt. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter. Medium body.
Bottle pours coffee-black with little hops and chocolate aroma. Sweet milk chocolate malt and roasted, but not bitter. Overall, a big sweet malty to-style Schwarzbier.

Really its the best black lager schwartzbier Ive ever had. Dark grain not burnt smooth. Creamy. Very enjoyable beer. Sweet chocolate. Increadible appearance. thick foamy. Malty get it! Amazing from these guys.

Bottle @ home, picked up at Wilburs. Black appearance with a thin brown head. Aroma has cookies and cream, chocolate, lots of roast, and some grassy hops. Medium sweetness. Low bitterness. Creamy dark chocolate flavor with some marzipan, vanilla, and pecans. Pretty good.

Bottle.

Head is initially small, frothy, light brown, mostly diminishing.
Body is dark brown to black.

Aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, unsweetened chocolate), lightly hoppy (herbs), with notes of minerals/stones and char, hint of cassis.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Surprisingly decent considering the other 2 beers Ive tried from Squatters were both drain pours. Minerally and relatively authentic nose. Drinkable balance albeit ultimately too sweet Pretty good job.
Pour from bottle is dark brown to black, clear but light permeates the beer, the aroma is a lager dark malty, taste is roasted crisp, finish is slightly sweet and Smokey

Squatters Black Forest Schwarzbier has a thick, foamy, creamy, beige head, a dark brown appearance, and very heavy lacing left behind on the glass. The aroma is of dark malt, brown bread crust, and standardized "beer smell". Taste is of creamy, dark malt, brown bread crust, sweetness, and subdued bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium and a bit slick, and Squatters Black Forest Schwarzbier finishes crisp, refreshing, and highly drinkable. I can see why this beer has won seven major medals. RJT
Pours mahogany with a sizable tan head. Well-balanced with coffee, chocolate and a bit of smoke.
Deep brown almost black with a cream head. Nose is roasted malts, light coffee and crisp. Smooth palate, bitter roast, dry, chocolate, dash of coffee.
A quite strong coffee aroma. This is pretty accurate style-wise though way more coffee than Id like. Okay.

Draft Flight 9/02 (Brewpub-SLC)-Pours a dark brown with red hues. Aroma of sweetness, caramel, and fruits. Taste of nutty, fruits, chocolate, and malt. This medium to full bodied brew is pretty tasty.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 6% Bottle version: Roasted malt (burnt, coffee) and sweet/caramel aroma. Sweet, roasted coffee/cocoa malt flavor. Caramel, and subtle raisin. Nice balance of malt flavors.

Coffee-like roasted, sweet aroma. Roasted malt flavor (cocoa, coffee)--with sweet, light caramel malt flavors, and maybe a little dark fruit. Subtle nutty flavor in finish. Nice balance of different malt flavors. (7/5/8/4/16)

Mug @ brewpub in SLC 
Appearance: dark brown with a tan head and lots of lace left in the glass 
Aroma: roasted malt with some nuts 
Taste: roasted malt with some hop bitterness. A hint of smokiness finishes this beer out nicely.  
This is a very good Schwartzbier.

GABF 2005.  Pours a nice woody black with a good head.  Aroma is light nutty and hints of roast- light chocolate- a bit of tar and dark fruits earthy hops.  Medium crystal malt sweetness, light toast upfront hints of nuts and chocolate- then everything fades and becomes a bit bland and weak in the end.  Meh.

On tap at the downtown brewpub in Salt Lake City, Utah. Pours a beautiful dark reddish brown hue with a huge light brown head. The aroma is full of roasted malts and some light fruit. The flavor was excellent; tons of malt here, roasted and full. A nice fruity flavor, sweet but not too sweet. Some light hops and a very nice full and creamy mouthfeel round it out. Just an excellent beer. I wish this was bottled so I could ship some out. Squatters kicks ass.

Draft pint at the brewpub.  Its schwarz alright!  This is a beauty with a full, sticky head.  Sweet malty aroma.  Nice tight black malt flavors ... solid, solid malt with a nice little Teutonic hop bite to finish it off.  Among the better Schwarzs Ive head in a while, think this would go toe-to-toe with Kostritzer. (#2791, 4/12/2007)
GABF 2002: Not bad.  SLightly roasted.  Damn good for Squatters.
